The claim highlights the opposition: s argument that the only cost incurred by opponents of Section 5 is the paper, postage, and manpower required to send copies of legislation to the federal government for review. This aspect focuses on the financial aspect of the claim and its implications.
The expert: s verdict also mentions the high cost associated with adhering to Section 5 requirements when states or jurisdictions want to make changes to their election processes. This aspect emphasizes the opponents' concern about the financial burden imposed by the provisions of Section 5.
